name: Straight Bar Cable Curls
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a cable machine with the straight bar attachment set to chest height.

2. Grip the straight bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and your elbows close to your body.

3. Keep your core engaged, shoulders relaxed, and your chest up throughout the exercise.

4. Slowly curl the bar upwards towards your shoulders, squeezing your biceps as you contract the muscles.

5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.

6. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, stretching your biceps as you lower.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping control and a full range of motion throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Straight bar cable curls are an isolation exercise targeting the biceps muscle group using a cable machine with a straight bar attachment.
